reviews.sentence: Great Stay. Stayed one night on Mariot points during trip with family member to MD Anderson Hospital. One of the best stays I have had in a hotel in quite some time considering the circumstances. Hotel staff at check in was very friendly and helpful. I arrived near the end of the evening social and the lady running the evening social was very helpful and pleasant and did not make us feel hurried at all even though the social was ending in 10 minutes. Room was very spacious and the beds very comfortable. My brother slept in the living area on the couch and slept very well. Room was very clean and quiet. The morning breakfast was pretty good and not crowded at all. Morning of departure front desk staff made me couple of pages of photocopies for no charge and were very polite about it. Overall a great stay. The hotel staff did say at some point the hotel was 20 years old though it was hard to tell for the most part as it had mostly a modern look and feel to it only way the hotel looked aged was the entry ways to the rooms looks like they need some updating. While I did stay on points I would definitely consider doing a paid stay here if the occasion arose to do so. A big thanks to the hotel staff for making my one night stay a great stay. I came away from my stay very impressed with this hotel.

Rooms Could use an update. The hotel grounds were pretty nice. The staff was nice and very helpful when I arrived with no luggage because it was delayed. The lobby was being updated while I was at the hotel. Also housekeeping missed cleaning the room I was staying in bed was made but trash was not removed and the tub still had hair in it. I probably would look at staying at another Mariot hotel in the area if I come to Houston again. Overall my stay was just ok.

Nice hotel. Convenient location. All in all it was fine and I will stay again. A bit old. Could use better mattress and why do hoteks have sectional sofas with no end. The cushions slide too much. Very nice staff. Breakfast was ok bit as it was included no complaints. It was busy but still comfortable. Need to update the locks in the door. I had to use my keys at least 3 times for the door to unlock. My son has his key changed 3 times.

MD Anderson Checkup. The Rotary House was unavailable. Several floors are under renovation there. This hotel was suggested. It was perfect for this visit. We traveled to Houston on a Tuesday. Stayed over night for my husbands check up on Wednesday. Flew home Wednesday evening. The staff is friendly and helpful. There are restaurants within walking distance or a short cab drive around the corner. Breakfast is included. It looked good. We were not able to eat it because his appointments were very early. The most important thing is that a shuttle is available starting at 60 AM to MD and other medical facilities. Also for a one night stay the price was reasonable. It was clean and had exactly what we needed for a short stay.

Terrible room needed maintenance. Went to Houston to visit Rice University. This hotel was close and reasonably priced. We checked in late and the man at the front desk was very courteous. Our room was not clean hair in the bathtub counter surface of the kitchenette and knobs on the air conditioner were sticky closet door would not close refrigerator did not work. Hotel was noisy. There were gaps around the exterior door as well as around the door to an adjoining room. The gaps were large enough to see light as well as recognize the outline of furniture in the adjoining room. The next morning we asked to have the refrigerator fixed. Front desk said they would send a repairman. That evening when we returned from sight seeing the refrigerator was still broken. Called the night front desk attendant and he sent a repairman within minutes. Checked out a day early. Nighttime desk attendant. He was very courteous and efficient. Daytime employees. Breakfast. Condition of rooms.

Not Mariots best. I stay in a lot of Mariot hotels with my work. This one is clearly on the bad side of their hotels. It is a two room suite with a small window unit for air conditioning. That means one room is cold and the other room is hot. The hotel is old and has not been updated in a long time. The bathroom was dingy. The tub drained slow so housekeeping had removed the stopper to help the water get out. All in all you can sleep in the hotel and they do have breakfast in the morning. However if you are used to staying in the more modern updated Mariot properties this one is not it.

Not bad but rooms need a refresh. Location to NRG stadium and Texas Medical center is excellent. On site security lobby and breakfast areas are nice. Room was comfortable enough but due for remodel. They show the age of the hotel.

Nice hotel close to UH and freeway access. Older hotel but updated. Beds comfortable. Rooms clean. Staff friendly. In town visiting my son at uh. Had no trouble getting everywhere we needed to be from this location.

Large Suites. Rooms are large but could use a little update in the small bathroom. I slept like a baby the bed was extremely comfortable. I celebrated my bday so I had several people over in a double room suite which had a wet bar fridge and micro. The seating area was completely separate from the sleeping area plenty of room almost like a small living room it was so cute. The bedding area looks plain with the white down blankets as seen in the pictures but do not let that fool you. I stay at Mariot a lot and the had a standard for their hotels it was exceptional. A swimming pool and spa was fully operational. Will stay again.
Check in was quick and easy. Had a maintenance issue in room that was quickly remedied. Good location for what we needed. Just not the cleanest place.

The hotel is older and definitely in need of some updates however the rooms were clean the breakfast was better than most and the staff was very attentive and courteous. We were very happy with our stay.

We were staying for our grandsons baseball tournament at the University of Houston. Location was good and all the service was great. Once they start renovation in June it will be really good. The colors are super.

Comfort and compassion. My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel due to needing to be in the area for medical reasons. Many people stay here that have serious medical situations and the manager and staff are very understanding and accommodating. The hotel manager Mike G is a compassionate person who clearly understands the stress that many of his guests are going through and does his best to make their time at the hotel relaxing and comfortable. The staff here is well trained friendly courteous and considerate. The hotel is currently undergoing a 100 makeover but there is minimal if any inconvenience. There is a very nice happy hour on weekdays where complimentary beer and wine and several snacks are served. A nice touch for the guests. Breakfast is also complimentary and it is a good onemuch better than the minimal continental breakfasts that many other hotels serve. Free shuttle service is provided within 2 miles of the hotel which is very convenient especially for those who have to make multiple trips to the medical facilities. Good size rooms which are currently outdated but are well maintained. I am sure the renovations that are being performed will enhance this hotels appeal even further. We will be back.

Horrible mess. Do not stay here under any circumstance. Old outdated mess 3rd floor. I love Springhil ’s and I stay in them all the time. This is the worst one by far. I ca n’t believe this is a Hilton hotel. Hilton should be ashamed to let one of their properties look like this. I ca n’t believe they have their name associated with such a motel. Just cause you put new flat screen TVs in the room does n’t mean it ’s updated. Spiderwebs in the corners. Outdated old dirty carpet nasty dingy furniture broken dusty lamps outdated pictures dinted up cabinets. A Model 6 is better than this place. Remodel this disaster immediately or knock it down. I want my points back. Will NEVER stay here again. I ’m insulted. I ’m apauled. They better be glad I booked only one night and checked in very late. I ca n’t believe the reviews that are on here. It ’s a disgrace to mislead people into thinking this place is nice. Do n’t believe these other reviewa or the photos either. The photos must be from when this dump opened back in the 70s.
Very Good. The hotel was being renovated. I was giving a a room that had already been renovated. It was great. I feel the hotel as a whole will be great when renovation is complete.

This hotel is in the middle of a renovation project. While it is a little bit of a construction zone right now you can tail it is going to be really nice when finished. The breakfast was excellent. We have kids in college in the Houston area and this is our new place to stay.

Second time staying. They have done a great overhaul on this hotel. We stayed two night while going to MD Anderson. The staff is outstanding for check in to check out. The breakfast area is new and clean with plenty of room. Nice area to have a cup of coffee outside and just relax for a while. The rooms have been updated and have everything you would need. Plenty of places to charge all your stuff. The pool area was clean and we will kept. Did use the hot tub but not the pool. The new market area to pick up a snack is a nice touch as well. They have a evening snack s and drinks but did not have time to try it so can not really provided much info about it. Over all this is a great place and a great location just a few minutes from the medical center.

Better than the Average Overall. The updated rooms and the futuristic feel was over the top Excellence. A bit pricey and No room service. No Bottles of water in the room other hotels provide at least 2 complimentary bottles.
Clean updated spacious rooms. Close to Rice University and many things we needed access to.
Excellent property. Newly renovated and in a great location. Happy Hour snacks leave a lot to be desired though.
